result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott W Slotowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott W Slotowski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott W Slotowski was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Scott W Slotowski was found guilty of Intentionally Point Firearm At Person [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).
  • Scott W Slotowski was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Cash bond posted shall be applied.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Pay DNA surcharge.   
May not have face to face contact with Sherry L W, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott W Slotowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court reviewed letter received on 3/13/15 and no action taken; copies sent to attorneys.
Bond applied; partial refund   ds/mg  ck#15CH073588

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, Scott W Slotowski, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Counts 2 & 3 - Court imposes and stays 9 months in the KCJ w/ huber concurrent to each other.  Count 4 - Court imposes and stays 90 days in the KCJ w/ Huber consecutive to Counts 2 & 3.    Sentence is withheld on all 3 counts; Deft. placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 60 days in the KCJ commencing on 2/7/15 at 8:00 AM.  Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.  Appeal Rights given.  (Atty Bielski needs to return the original signed Appeals Form to the court)

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Scott W Slotowski, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Victim present in court.  Count 1 - Dismissed by the State.  Counts 2 & 3 - Dangerous weapon enhancer is dismissed and Deft. pleads Guilty w/o that enhancer; found guilty by the court.  Count 4 - Deft. pleads Guilty as charged; found guilty by the court.  Case is assigned to ADA Graveley he's unavailable today.  Sentencing adj. to 1/21/15 at 10:30 AM.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Not to possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription. No weapons. No contact with Shari W. or her residence other than electronic communications for purposes of operating tree-cutting business.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Don Bielski. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Bielski. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 12-17-14 @ 8:30am. Atty. Bielski and Atty. Graveley have agreed to bond modification. Bond amount remains the same, but conditions amended to allow contact with Shari W. electronically for purposes of operating tree-cutting business. All other conditions remain the same. Amended cash bond signed in court.
of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Bielski. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman.
